reviews.text: First time to London, and therefore first time to this hotel. Staff is friendly and efficient. Room is spacious and clean. WIFI Internet connection is fast (charge applicable). However, as it is an older property (that has been updated). Certain things cannot be changed. For example, you can only choose "high or low" for air-conditioning, no specfiic temperature control. Shower tiles are little old. TVs are not flat-screens. Small complaints, but understandably as it's not a big city. Also tried their casual restaurant, London Grill. Decent lunch buffet. $10 for roast beef lunch (also chicken entree if you are not into beef). The only gripe I have is that the desserts should be encased because there were fruit flies circling around. By the way, their gym is under renovation for next 3 weeks., but they give courtesy day pass to YMCA across the street, so it's even better.
reviews.title: Acceptable, even though may not be the typical Hilton standards.

reviews.text: Stayed here for 1 night in June for business. Hotel was fairly cheap (around $119 I think). The rooms are large, but a bit dated and need some refreshing. The buffet breakfast was quite good and cheap ($14/person). However they charged me $2 to print something from the business center. Is paper that expensive? Seems a little nickel and diming if you ask me. The workers were friendly enough, however check-in was slow and they seemed a bit disorganized.
reviews.title: A bit dated, but pretty ok for London, Ontario

reviews.text: I visit this hotel every three weeks and I've had great service and I've had poor service. I always stay at the executive level and you would think the service there is consistently special but it isn't! John is very helpful and remembers my name. Dean at the front desk sometimes remembers me, sometimes gives me attitude. Sometimes there's a concierge but most times there isn't one. I've not had any concierge person offer to help me. The check-in machine at the front desk worked once. Last year, I always got chocolates as an evening amenity but that has disappeared for the last little while. At this week's stay, there wasn't even a luggage rack! Service and quality of the rooms are inconsistent. The plastic flowers and the ragged rugs on the executive floors need a major overhaul as it feels like its the 1980s and have not been updated since then.
reviews.title: Inconsistent service

reviews.text: Stayed here b/c of conference in Conference Centre. I know this is a "big" city and it is located downtown but I was disappointed in dirty carpets, outdated bathroom, old TV...just the little things that make you think "I'll come back again." I traveled with a friend who had a smoking room...it was disgusting so in this hotel it is obvious that smokers are second rate citizens. When the guy from the desk came up to help with A/C, he used the word "hideous" and that it was. I am an ex-smoker and the worst kind of anti-smoking advocate, but this was her first time traveling to a conference like this and I was disappointed for her. The beds were the best part. I had a great night's sleep. Not a lot of noise. Ate in restaurant here once and it was average but had a great British server who was quite delightful. And the doorman who dresses up in the Old English suit was a great sport. Would I stay here again?? Honestly, I think I would look elsewhere if I had to pay the same rate.
reviews.title: Over rated and tired hotel

reviews.text: Great staff, very courteous and friendly, but the hotel is way overdue for renovation. The bath counter tops came to mid thigh so bending over to wash your face or brush your teeth became a workout. The faucets were old and worn and the shower head barely high enough to get under for a 6 foot person. For a full size Hilton Hotel to go this long without renovation is unusual. And then the fire alarm on the ceiling would periodically give off a bright light which I though was a searchlight coming in through the window shades. Truly weird, and I had only had one glass of wine that evening. Until they renovate try another hotel.
reviews.title: Way overdue for renovation

reviews.text: I recently stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. After reading some of the other reviews posted, I was a bit nervous about staying here but I am happy to report that my stay was very good. Upon check-in I found I had been upgraded to the executive floor. My room was spacious and comfortable with just a few minor complaints. The bed was up on a platform and I had to jump up to get on it. I measured it and it was over 3 feet off the ground -- about a foot higher than the average bed. The desk was large and the dresser was also very oversized and tall. The TV was old, but it worked well. The bathroom was clean and everything worked well, but the sink was very low off the ground -- in direct contrast to the bed. Perhaps the workmen who installed the bed were tall and those working on the bathroom were short! In any case, even I found I was stooping over the sink and I am only 5'4" tall. Just outside the bathroom there was another sink and mirror -- also at the same low level. There was only one phone in the room and it was beside the bed. This is the first hotel I have stayed in that did not have a phone on the desk. I commented on it to the room service delivery-person and they said there should be a phone on the desk. I called downstairs to ask, and they said it must have been broken and they would see if they could bring another one. They never called back or brought a phone.
reviews.title: Very pleasant stay!

reviews.text: Executive floor privileges include afternoon hors d'oeuvres and a lovely breakfast buffet. I ordered room service twice and it came quickly. The food was very good. My room was extremely quiet. I never heard a sound from above or below or beside me. The heating system is a bit old and noisy. I found that if I turned it off for the night I slept much better.
reviews.title: falling apart and dump

reviews.text: The parking is located next to the building and you get free in-and-out privileges. Contrary to what their website says, they do not have an on-site convenience store or a gift shop.
reviews.title: Clean comfortable hotel with friendly staff!

reviews.text: All staff were extremely friendly.
reviews.title: "Take Me to the Hilton!"
nothing special.
reviews.text: I have to pick a hotel in London for April 2010 and thought about this one as this is where the other team mates on my sons team are staying, Which I CANNOT understand why! the first room they gave us the toilet did not work. the room was not furnished nicely at all, then they moved us to another room in which the fire alarm was covered up by tape. I found staff to be rude and you had to pay for parking and yes most of the time you had to park across the street. There are other hotels in which I have been looking for that offer free parking and a complimentary breakfast and wifi. I hope to NEVER see the insides of this place again. No way should this be 4 star. The wallpaper was peeling and scratches on the doors. Go elswhere

i initially had a room with poor wireless internet connection which didn't work out despite talking to IT so they moved me promptly to a different room where i didn't experience the same problem. very nice people. rooms are clean. room service was prompt. beds are comfortable. i thought the bathrooms were so-so and the TV is not a modern flat screen.
reviews.title: decent place to stay

reviews.text: overall i think it's a decent place to stay.
reviews.title: 22nd FLOOR WITH ZERO PRIVACY... A SUPER 8 MOTEL WOULD HAVE BEEN BETTER- DO NOT STAY HERE IF YOU CAN HELP IT!~

reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel a couple of times during August/September 2009...
reviews.title: ok for a brief stay

reviews.text: The hotel itself is 'ok.' Its extremely outdated, and is in desperate need of a makeover.
reviews.title: You can do better for the price

reviews.text: I typically stay at the Homewood Suites down by the 401, which is a much better overall value- seeing as you get free dinner and breakfast, as well as free parking (and its a NEW hotel). At the Hilton, its 100 years old... (ok, maybe only 90 years old!), parking is over $13 daily and if its raining, you have to walk outside with your luggage and get drenched... Front desk staff were "okay" all 3 times I stayed... although somewhat inconsistent... 1 time I did not receive an internet access code, another time I was not given my Hilton Honors Points/Airmiles for the stay (this was August 27th, and I have sent 3 'missing points requests' to which I have not received a single acknowledgement!! NICE EH!??!)...
reviews.title: We had an excellent visit - close to amenties, enjoyed the staff and food service.

reviews.text: Stayed here for a hockey tournament with Bantam aged boys and the hotel was great. Most families were placed on the 'Team Floor'. Rooms were very spacious and comfortable. Parking was included in our rate and hotel was quiet so there was a lot available. Location was great in downtown where we could walk to many restaurants.
reviews.title: Hockey Tournament

reviews.text: This hotel is beautiful. The staff for the most part were very friendly. The bellman and Terri the waitress in the restaurant remembered me from 3 years ago!
reviews.title: not what I booked

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My disapointment was in my reservation. I had asked for a suite. It was described to me as a one bedroom with 1 and a half bathrooms, and a double sofa bed. I was expecting a room with a bedroom and seperate sitting area and a full bathroom and a 1/2 which to me is a sink and toilet. What I got was a slightly larger than normal room with a bed and sofa bed in the same room. A full bathroom with an additional sink and vanity outside.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Calling the front desk for a wake up call I was made to feel like I was "bothering" him.
reviews.title: Comfortable; convenient location; very friendly staff; could use renovation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A brief overview: we arrived to find there was no parking available – we had to park in the lot across the street.
reviews.title: Hilton London is getting old
